abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Port Sector Reform
            Project is to assist the government in improving the
            efficiency of Egyptian ports and ancillary services in line
            with the CAS objectives of promoting private sector
            development and growth in exports. The project will
            restructure the organizational and financial systems in the
            sector and attract private investment to manage and operate
            publicly-held enterprises in the sector. The project funds
            the  operating expenses of the Secretariat Unit and provides
            technical assistance in three phases: 1) Phase 1 assesses
            deficiencies in trade logistics and potential for container
            transshipment at Egyptian ports and recommends a strategy to
            improve efficiency; and develops specifications and bid
            documents for port/trade management systems including EDI
            (Electronic Data Interchange) systems to facilitate trade.
            2) Phase 2 develops a policy framework which accommodates
            greater private participation in ports; and produces draft
            regulations for the port sector to implement the new policy
            of private participation. 3) Phase 3 a) creates a new
            structure for a corporatized organization in the sector and
            assists in its implementation; b) restructures the financial
            management systems for port sector entities to make them
            autonomous and self-financing; and c) develops a plan for
            privatizing selected units and a labor redeployment program.
